__TOC__

In order to track bugs (both software and packaging), many distributions have developed bug tracking systems to manage bug reports and to notify the package maintainers and reporters of changes. The table below shows some of the Debian and ''Ubuntu'' tools for tracking bugs.

'''Bug Tracking Systems (BTS)'''
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| Debian
| http://bugs.debian.org
|-
| ''Ubuntu''
| https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs
|}

'''Bugs for Specific Packages'''
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| Debian
| `http://bugs.debian.org/<packagename>`
|-
| ''Ubuntu''
| use search at ''Ubuntu'' BTS
|}

'''Bugs for Source Packages'''
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| Debian
| `http://bugs.debian.org/src:<packagename>`
|-
| ''Ubuntu''
| `https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/<packagename>/+bugs`
|}

'''Package Information'''
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| Debian
| http://packages.debian.org or `http://packages.qa.debian.org/<packagename>`
|-
| ''Ubuntu''
| http://packages.ubuntu.com or `https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/<packagename>` for source packages
|}
